content: If Thunderbird is running fine on one PC, try this: - exit TB on both PCs - copy the thunderbird folder at c:\users\<yourid>\appdata\roaming to external device and then copy to the same location on the second PC. You will be prompted for overwrites. Allow. - start TB and all should be there.

content:
Feedback and suggestions can be submitted here connect.mozilla.org

This is essentially a duplicate of this topic https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/questions/1405910 I have no intention to entering into an annual discussion on what you think should happen. I suggest you use the feedback link to offer your suggestions as to what should happen to the developers.

You might try https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/rebuilding-global-database as that can get lost at times.

Or you could file a bug https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/home because you are not going to get what you think you want by posting in support forums. That is neither feedback nor a bug report just your peers trying to help you based on what they know and have observed.

In your last topic on the subject, you said

Casual User said
Thanks for the reply. I still haven't fixed the problem I have sending e-mails in Thunderbird. I started to investigate how to view the code, but haven't gone too far with that. I'll have to put some items in the feedback forum at some point.

How is that going? This might help https://searchfox.org/comm-central/source/mailnews

content:
The red box would indicate you have pasted a table. Probably a one cell wide by one cell high table, but a table nonetheless. That is how spreadsheets work, in tables, so I am not surprised that is what it put into the clipboard to be pasted. Perhaps use Ctrl+Shift+V to paste only text instead of whatever is in the clipboard.

Once the table has no text in it you can select it like any other object and delete it with the delete key When selected it has little squares on the corners of the table cells
creator: MattAuSupport

content: Thanks Matt. That solved it. I knew what the problem was but was having trouble figuring out how to select the table element. BTW, I'm not seeing the squares in the corner of the table element when I select it so was having trouble figuring out when it was actually selected. Got it now! Thanks again!

content:
I am not sure exactly how the GLODA tokenizer works, but it certainly does not index entire emails or subjects or the quoted text in emails. It struggles with numbers of all sorts and also dates as they are essentially numbers.

Re: is something I would expect it to drop
creator: MattAuSupport

content: I forgot the link to the standard fix it for GLODA search issues. See https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/rebuilding-global-database
creator: MattAuSupport

content:
Search:

  • doesn't tokenize strings less than 3 characters
  • breaks all strings on punctuation, including numbers
  • only looks the first 20k a message (I think it was 20k)
  • does stemming (so the search terms "strings" and "string" will return the same results)

There are more, but those are the major ones
creator: wsmwk

content: This is on an Intel Mac, running macOS 13.6.4 and Betterbird 115.7.0. It also happened when I ran Thunderbird itself, which is why I switched to Betterbird.

content:
compacting rewrites the storage file completely and then replaces the existing one. So, I would expect issues if you clicked in a message in the folder being compacted. What is the size of this folder on disk? Right click the folder, select properties.

Is there three times the size of the folder free on the disk?
creator: MattAuSupport

content:
I suggest you start by updating your server settings, both incoming and outgoing to those recommended (essentially required) by your provider.

https://www.spectrum.net/support/internet/spectrum-email-server-settings

A summary is 

   Username: Your full Spectrum-provided email address    Password: Your Spectrum-provided email password    SSL: On    Protocol: IMAP    Port: 993    SMTP Port: 587    Requires Authentication: Yes, or checked

You SMTP setting are no authentication and no encryption. I suggest you change the authentication to password and the encryption to SSL as required by your provider.
creator: MattAuSupport

content: right click the folder, select properties and then the repair button That will re-index the underlying file. It will not change the data, nor will it put it back if for some reason you antivirus program quarantined the file at some point.
